Class Client

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--Client
public class Client
extends java.lang.Thread

This class implements the client of a service. An object of this class is created with a fuse. When the fuse is over the client requests a service. The service has both a priority and a duration. The client is a thread that dies once the service is completed.

Constructor Detail

Client

public Client(int id,
              int fuse,
              int priority,
              int duration,
              Robot robbie)
Construct this client.
Parameters:
id - Client's id. Used for tracing the execution.
fuse - Client's fuse. When the fuse is over, the client requests a service.
priority - Priority of the service requested by this client.
duration - Duration of the service requested by this client.
robbie - Robot to which the client asks the service.
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Client behavior. Sleep until the fuse is over, then ask the service to the robot.
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
